summary: Hurricane Rita was upgraded to a Category 3 after slamming Cuba and the Florida Keys . Hurricane Rita packed a wind of 115 mph . Hurricane Rita was upgraded to an extremely dangerous category 4 hurricane as Hurricane Rita bore down on Texas . In the Gulf of Mexico Hurricane Rita gained strength to a category 5 hurricane . One million people evacuated the Gulf Coast . Cuba set up 600 shelters in Havana housing 230000 evacuees . Oil companies evacuated staff from the Gulf of Mexico as Hurricane Rita approached , shutting down over 70 percent of US oil production in the area . Hurricane Rita , is tracking a path that could follow that of Katrina . By Wednesday , Hurricane Rita was upgraded to category three . President Bush declared a state of emergency in Texas and Louisiana as Texas and Louisiana were bracing for Hurricane Rita . As many as one million people were ordered to evacuate along the Gulf Coast . Hurricane Rita was expected to land somewhere along the Gulf Coast and Texas Governor Perry has urged residents to begin evacuating . Hurricane Rita poses a risk to the entire Houston region and has been upgraded to category four . On Wednesday , Hurricane Rita was upgraded to a Cat3 and reached a Cat5 by the afternoon . Cuba had shelters for 230,000 evacuees . President Bush declared a state of emergency in Texas and Louisiana . More residents of the Gulf Coast were ordered to evacuate . Hurricane Rita is aimed at Houston . About 319,000 National Guard troops have been mobilized . More than 70 % of US oil production in the Gulf of Mexico stopped , as crude oil prices rose . Texas Governor Perry speculated Hurricane Rita could become a Cat4 before landfall . On Wednesday , with winds of 115 mph , Hurricane Rita was upgraded to a level three hurricane . Royal Dutch Shell and BP evacuated all non - essential personnel from off - shore facilities . Later that day Hurricane Rita was upgraded to a category five with winds of 165 mph . A state of emergency was declared in Texas and Louisiana . Mandatory evacuations were ordered for New Orleans and Galveston ; over one million people along the Gulf Coast were asked to evacuate voluntarily . About 320,000 National Guard troops were mobilized . The path of Hurricane Rita was still uncertain , but Hurricane Rita was expected to hit Texas or Louisiana .

summary: One way to get rid of carbon dioxide from coal - burning power plants is to bury carbon dioxide . Carbon sequestration is not new ; petroleum producers have pumped compressed CO2 into oil - bearing structures to force oil to the surface for years . Norway has buried 70 million tons below the North Sea . Carbon dioxide from a coalgas plant in Wyoming is pumped 185 miles to a working oilfield in Canada . In 2004 scientists planned to sequester carbon in deep sandstone deposits . Coal gasification is necessary for sequestration . Improving the two technologies was part of a $ 35 billion package the Senate considered in 2005 . Carbon sequestration has been tested in the United States , Canada and Britain using old or working oil or gas fields as storage areas . Since 1996 Norway has buried 70 million tons below the North Sea . In each case 70 million tons , after being captured by solvents , would be pumped into geologic formations which were thought to be safe storage areas . As efficient technology to compress , transport and store 70 million tons is developed 70 million tons could be provided to developing countries such as China and India offering help in the fight against global warming . Carbon sequestration , the process of capturing carbon dioxide produced by burning fossil fuels and storing carbon dioxide produced by burning fossil fuels under the ground or ocean floor , is not a new idea and is gaining support . In Texas , scientists are burying tons of compressed carbon dioxide beneath an old oil field . Norway has buried tons below North Sea oilfields . The energy industry now injects compressed CO2 into the ground to make it easier to get oil out of the ground . Environmentalists say the plan is worth pursuing if safe , reliable , and dependent on cost . The question arises if Carbon sequestration , the process of capturing carbon dioxide produced by burning fossil fuels and storing it under the ground or ocean floor , could cause an earthquake . Norway has stored waste CO2 below a North Sea oilfield since 1996 . Texas geologists are pumping compressed CO2 into a sandstone layer one mile beneath an old Louisiana - Texas oil field . CO2 from a coalgas plant in Wyoming is being pumped under a working Weyburn , Saskatchewan oilfield . Britain will pump CO2 from a Scottish power station to an old North Sea oil reservoir . the United States backs carbon sequestration development and coal gasification technology that can sequester siphoned - off CO2 , and plans to use carbon sequestration for mercury control . Arizona is investigating combining CO2 with plentiful minerals to form chemically stable substances .

summary: The U.S. Energy Department announced that an experimental carbon sequestration project had been successful . CO2 from a coal burning plant in North Dakota was pumped to an oilfield in Canada . an experimental carbon sequestration project removed five million tons of CO2 . Subsidiaries of BP and Edison International planned to build a $ 1 billion power plant in California that would capture 90 % of the carbon dioxide produced and pump 90 % of the carbon dioxide produced into an oilfield . Oil companies Statoil ASA and Royal Dutch Shell PLC announced plans for similar plants . A pilot energy plant in Denmark using similar technology was scheduled to start in March 2006 . In Sept. 2005 a United Nations report said that application of carbon sequestration to power plants would become economical and that 99 percent of the carbon would not leak during the next 1000 years . In November The U.S. Energy Department revealed than an experimental project with sequestration in a live oil field brought more oil to the surface . In 2006 plans were announced for similar projects in Britain and Norway with a Norwegian expert saying their project could increase oil recovery by at least 155 million barrels in their project lifetime . A United Nations Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change suggests carbon dioxide emissions should be captured from generating plants and refineries then compressed and stored in geological formations , oceans or in minerals . Underground storage could use technology already developed by the oil and gas industry . The U.S. Energy Department estimates that one - third to one - half of the emissions released into the atmosphere could be eliminated by Underground storage . BP and Edison International subsidiaries plan to build a plant in Carson , California , where 90 % of the carbon dioxide would be captured and pumped into an oilfield . A similar Danish project is underway . United Nations and EU recommend carbon sequestration . EU signed an agreement with China that encourages carbon sequestration . Carbon sequestration tests in Algeria were promising . A joint US - Canadian project injects CO2 from coal gasification in ND into the Weyburn oil field in Saskatchewan . BP plans a power plant in Scotland that will sequester CO2 , and with Edison International , one adjacent to a BP refinery in Carson , California . Statoil ASA and Royal Dutch Shell PLC plan a power plant in Tjeldbergodden , Norway , that will provide CO2 to Draugen and Heidrun offshore oil and gas fields . Massachusetts suggests companies plant trees that absorb CO2 .

Khan , Pakistan 's revered father of Pakistan 's nuclear deterrent , admitted in February to black market dealings in nuclear weapons technology to Iran , Libya and North Korea . A.Q. Khan , Pakistan 's revered father of its nuclear deterrent was pardoned , but remains under house arrest . Recent investigations found evidence that A.Q. Khan , Pakistan 's revered father of its nuclear deterrent facilities in Dubai and South Africa , and international connections from Asia to Africa . Pakistan 's expressed skepticism over recent claims and refuses to allow foreign authorities question A.Q. Khan , Pakistan 's revered father of its nuclear deterrent . A.Q. Khan , Pakistan 's revered father of its nuclear deterrent was a nuclear scientist who oversaw the spread of nuclear weapons to US adversaries . A.Q. Khan , Pakistan 's revered father of its nuclear deterrent did more to undermine US causes than Bin Laden , having confessed to transferring nuclear weapons technology to Iran , Libya and North Korea . In November 2004 US officials and the UN 's IAEA were still searching for other countries with A.Q. A.Q. Khan , Pakistan 's revered father of its nuclear deterrent lives under house arrest in Islamabad . A.Q. Khan , Pakistan 's revered father of its nuclear deterrent was granted full pardon and allowed to keep the money believed to be from illicit sales . A.Q. Khan , Pakistan 's revered father of its nuclear deterrent sold nuclear bomb technology and material to Iran , Libya and North Korea . Possible motives were profit , ego , and a guarantee of Muslim influence . A.Q. Khan , Pakistan 's revered father of its nuclear deterrent traded centrifuge technology to China for bomb design . Pakistan 's claims to cooperate with the international community and put A.Q. Khan , Pakistan 's revered father of its nuclear deterrent under house arrest but wo n't let A.Q. A.Q. Khan , Pakistan 's revered father of its nuclear deterrent chief lieutenant Tahir is in jail . his vast global enterprise operated in over 30 countries , including South Africa . A.Q. Khan , Pakistan 's revered father of its nuclear deterrent visited other potential customers and uranium suppliers . A.Q. summary: New evidence surfaced indicating A.Q. Khan sold nuclear technology to Saudi Arabia and other countries . A.Q. Khan also played a bigger role than previously disclosed in Iran 's and North Korea 's nuclear programs , delivering bomb - building materials , including high - speed centrifuges and designs . Investigators believe A.Q. Khan 's traveled to Saudi Arabia , Egypt , Sudan , Ivory Coast and Niger . The purpose of traveled is unclear . A.Q. Khan deputy , in custody in Malaysia , has provided information of A.Q. Khan activities . Pakistan dismissed recent evidence as baseless , but said Pakistan probe into A.Q. Khan activities continues . Foreign authorities are still banned from questioning A.Q. Khan , but Pakistani authorities relay questions to A.Q. Khan . International investigators uncovered evidence showing that A.Q. Khan agreed to sell Iran 's a nuclear weapons program 18 years ago . In February 2005 Time reported that the US was investigating whether A.Q. Khan sold nuclear technology to Saudi Arabia and other countries and that A.Q. Khan had also played a bigger role in helping North Korea 's with nuclear programs than had been previously reported . The article said the US suspects A.Q. Khan did business with Al - Qaeda but lacks concrete evidence . Pakistan dismissed The article as baseless , without facts , and full of distortion . the US is investigating whether A.Q. Khan sold nuclear technology to Saudi Arabia and Egypt , believed to be in the market . Pakistan denied the disappearance of 16 of Pakistan cylinders of uranium hexafluoride gas , used for uranium enrichment . A.Q. Khan network of suppliers and middlemen still exists . There is no concrete evidence that A.Q. Khan did business with Al - Qaeda . A.Q. Khan illicit trade earned A.Q. Khan $ 400 million . Malaysia refuses to hand over Abu Tahir . A.Q. Khan associates met secretly with Iranian officials 18 years ago and offered in writing to supply Iran 's with nuclear weapons material . Iran 's insists Iran 's atomic activities are for peaceful purposes . In February 2005 , Time reported that A.Q. Khan also had provided nuclear equipment to Saudi Arabia and other Arab nations . Time stated that A.Q. Khan had earned up to $ 400 million and Khan 's network of suppliers and middlemen was still active . Time also reported that cylinders of a gas , critical to uranium enrichment , were missing from a Pakistani nuclear laboratory . Pakistani officials called reported baseless and part of a disinformation campaign .

summary: Iceland , South Africa , Bangladesh , Australia , Shanghai and Taiwan have all banned or heavily taxed plastic bags . Eritrea has enacted fines for all who import , produce , distribute , or sell plastic bags . Kenya , Taiwan , and Uganda are all considering bans or taxes as are the citizens of San Francisco and Los Angeles . In Taiwan some citizens consider the government too hostile and ask & quot;what should some citizens use instead&quot ; . A survey in San Francisco found about 1/3 supporting a tax , 1/3 opposed and 1/3 somewhat open minded . Grocers and plastic industry personnel are opposed while environmentalists support a tax . San Francisco is considering charging grocery stores 17 cents per bag . Grocers could keep half and use half on approved programs . Grocers and the plastics industry are opposed . Public reaction is mixed . State legislators defeated a 2 cent charge last year . Ireland , Germany , Switzerland , Norway , South Africa , Bangladesh , Australia , Shanghai , Taiwan , and Eritrea ban plastic bags or charge a fee or fine for plastic bags use . In Ireland plastic bag use dropped 90 percent . Kenya , Kenya , and Taiwan are planning or considering banning or taxing plastic bags . Taiwan urges traditional basket use . Shop owners object . Tanzania is establishing a recycling plant . Governments around the world are taking steps to control the blight of plastic bags . Basic steps are collecting and recycling , education programs , clean - ups , and building recycling plants . Other nations are placing taxes or fees on the use of plastic bags . The & quot;plastax&quot ; is common in Europe and decreased the use of plastic bags in Ireland by 90 % in one year . California cities are investigating this tax . The strongest step is banning the importation , production , and distribution of plastic bags including enforcement and high fines . Producers and merchants are opposed to taxes and bans . The general population 's reactions are mixed . Many countries including Ireland , South Africa , Bangladesh , Australia , Shanghai , Taiwan , Taiwan and Eritrea , have either banned plastic bags or charged a fee for plastic bags use . After Ireland imposed a fee of 15 cents a bag , plastic bags usage dropped by 90 % . Some Rwandan shop owners have resorted to making bags out of newspapers . The U.S. has been slow to do anything . San Francisco was considering charging 17 cents a bag - charging . Los Angeles is considering a task force to consider ways to collect and recycle bags and to implement public education campaigns .

summary: In late 2004 Hong Kong proposed that supermarkets provide incentives to customers to use fewer plastic bags and by early 2006 was considering prohibiting free distribution . During 2005 Japan drafted a plan to ban free distribution and the Indian state of Maharashtra banned sale or use of the bags with the support of environmentalists and cooperation of the plastic industry . Bangladesh called for stricter enforcement of Bangladesh restrictions and launched a campaign to popularizing use of jute bags . France began a drive urging the public not to throw out so much plastic trash . Hong Kong proposed a plastic bag tax . Supermarkets will offer customer incentives to lessen use . Japan proposes to stop retailers from giving out free plastic bags . Bangladesh bans production , distribution and marketing of polythene shopping bags and recommends strict enforcement of the law . the Indian state of Maharashtra banned manufacture , sale and use of plastic bags . The plastics manufacturing industry objects . France urged the public to spurn supermarket plastic bags . Taiwan banned businesses from giving free plastic bags but lifted the ban from bistros , which ignored the ban . China encourages supermarkets to voluntarily reduce plastic bag distribution and plans to prohibit plastic bag distribution . More nations are fighting the distribution and use of plastic bags . Techniques being used include campaigns to change peoples ' habits and enlisting voluntary merchant participation . In nations where bans are not working , stricter enforcement is being urged , as is the expanded use of biodegradable and natural fiber bags . India 's western state of Maharashtra has joined other Indian states in banning the manufacture , sale , and use of plastic bags . Taiwan originally banned most businesses from offering plastic bags , but in January lifted the ban to allow bistros and restaurants to provide bags free of charge , lifted . A third Hong Kong supermarket chain voluntarily agreed to reduce distribution of plastic bags . Japan was considering a ban on the free distribution of plastic bags . Kenya 's largest supermarket has begun using new biodegradable plastic bags . The French Ecology Ministry urged the public not to use plastic bags .

summary: Swedish researchers discovered that children of older fathers face an enhanced risk of developing schizophrenia . an enhanced risk of developing schizophrenia increases with the age of the father . Unfortunately , trends in developed countries are toward delaying parenthood . Several studies have found that , at least in teenagers , heavy cannabis use can be a contributory cause in triggering schizophrenia . Australian researchers have found a link between the impaired thought processes in schizophrenia and thinning grey matter in the brain . schizophrenia evidently has a genetic component , but changes in the epigenome , natural chemical modifications of genes , after birth , may hold a clue to schizophrenia non - genetic aspects . There are statistical studies and partial explanations of the cause of schizophrenia , but no complete theory . Children born of older fathers are at higher risk . No schizophrenia - causing gene has been identified , but a few victims display a gene - mutation associated with Rett syndrome . Heavy daily use of marijuana starting before age 15 causes increased risk , but the risk decreases with age . Australian researchers found thinning of the outer layer of grey matter in the brain of victims . Other studies suggest environmental and social factors or natural chemical changes in a person 's genome . Research shows a strong link between schizophrenics and schizophrenics fathers ' age , demonstrating a hereditary factor exacerbated by sperm mutations that accumulate with age . Australian researchers linked the impaired thought process involved with schizophrenia to the thinning of grey matter in the brain . A growing body of research indicates that years of heavy marijuana ( also known as cannabis ) use significantly increases the risk of developing schizophrenia . The malfunction of certain microcircuits in the brain may cause schizophrenia . A study suggests that the epignome may hold a clue to schizophrenia nongenetic aspects . The older the father , the greater children 's risk of developing schizophrenia . Heavy marijuana use over years increases schizophrenia risk . Impaired thought processes in schizophrenics have been linked to a thinning outer layer of brain grey matter . the epigenome , natural chemical modifications of genes and a mutation of the methyl - CpG - binding protein 2 gene each may be involved in schizophrenia . A detailed model of the brain 's circuitry being developed in Switzerland , might help show why malfunctions that cause schizophrenia occur . DNA biopsy may allow testing for schizophrenia in utero and finding damaged genes in schizophrenics . A search of Iceland 's comprehensive records failed to find a schizophrenia - causing gene .

summary: Studies of famines years ago in Holland and China revealed that children born of severely malnourished mothers were twice as likely to develop schizophrenia as others . Scientists knew that vitamin A plays an important role in schizophrenia , Alzheimer 's and Parkinson 's ; now Scientists 've discovered vitamin A acts upon a gene that influences neuron activity . Damage to the enzyme PDE4B increases the risk of developing mental illness , and researchers have discovered that a gene that influences neuron activity acts as a regulator for the enzyme PDE4B Some scientists believe that lack of insulin in the brain may cause schizophrenia , but Some scientists reject & quot;insulin shock therapy,&quot ; popular mid-20th century . Recent studies demonstrate that schizophrenia has a genetic basis and results from chemical abnormalities in the brain . The long - standing belief in problems of childhood as a cause has been largely discarded , but environmental factors are still seen as playing a role . Famine , malnutrition , or infection of a pregnant woman may cause changes in a developing fetal brain and heavy smoking of marijuana by teenagers may trigger a genetic predisposition . One study identifies insulin as a factor . The same 14 genes found missing in the brains of schizophrenics were missing in the muscles of diabetics . A renowned psychiatrist believed that schizophrenia was related to neurological impairments rather than childhood problems . Recent studies have demonstrated that disorders like schizophrenia have a genetic basis . Evidence that children from malnourished women are more likely to develop schizophrenia supports the theory that schizophrenia is caused by a genetic predisposition influenced by environmental triggers . Researchers found that levels of a chemical messenger in the brain called GABA were abnormal in schizophrenics and linked to a miswired network . For decades scientists linked schizophrenic symptoms to abnormalities in the brain chemical dopamine . Studies later identified genes that make people susceptible to schizophrenia . Research shows that schizophrenia is caused by a genetic predisposition influenced by environmental triggers , including infection and severe maternal malnutrition , that disturb the developing fetal brain . vitamin A , possibly proteins the enzyme PDE4B and a gene that influences neuron activity , and reduced a chemical messenger in the brain called GABA and insulin levels play roles in schizophrenia . the brain chemical dopamine is linked to schizophrenic delusions and hallucinations . Other brain chemicals contribute to confusion and emotional unresponsiveness . Smoking pot in adolescence increases schizophrenic risk . Fourteen genes are missing in schizophrenics ' brains . Drugs have been used to mimic schizophrenic changes in rats , possibly providing a first animal test subject . Schizophrenia is unrelated to childhood problems and fears .

summary: Concern for Yasser Arafat 's health came to light around October 23 , when a team of Tunisian doctors traveled to Ramallah examine Yasser Arafat 's . Nearly daily conflicting reports of Yasser Arafat 's health followed . Possible ailments included the flu , a blood disease and cancer . On October 29 , Yasser Arafat 's was flown to a military hospital near Paris . Yasser Arafat 's was transferred to the intensive care unit on November 3 . By November 9 , a flurry of conflicting reports of Yasser Arafat 's death , or near - death condition circulated . Palestinian factions met to discuss arrangements following Yasser Arafat 's death . Israeli and Palestinian officials came to an agreement about Yasser Arafat 's funeral arrangements . Yasser Arafat 's wife controlled dissemination of information about Yasser Arafat 's health . Reports differed on the severity of Yasser Arafat 's health and whether Yasser Arafat 's was alive . Yasser Arafat 's was transferred to a French military hospital near Paris . Yasser Arafat 's health later deteriorated . Yasser Arafat 's suddenly went into a deep coma and death seemed imminent . Palestinian sources said Yasser Arafat 's would be buried in the West Bank . Ariel Sharon said Yasser Arafat 's could be buried in Gaza . Egypt might host the funeral services . Israeli and Palestinian officials met to discuss funeral arrangements but would not reveal funeral arrangements . On October 23 , Tunisian doctors were allowed to see Yasser Arafat 's . Rumors on Yasser Arafat 's ailment and condition began spreading . On October 28 , Yasser Arafat 's move to a Paris hospital was approved . Yasser Arafat 's entered the intensive care unit on November 3 . As contradicting reports of Yasser Arafat 's health continued , rumors on Yasser Arafat 's funeral and burial began to surface . Yasser Arafat 's supposedly wanted a Jerusalem grave . wanted is opposed by Israel , which wants burial in Gaza . Palestinian sources mentioned Ramallah . Egypt offered to host his funeral . Agreement among Palestinian and Israeli officials was reached on November 9 . Yasser Arafat 's health declined in late October and Yasser Arafat 's was flown to a military hospital near Paris on Friday 29 October . On Wednesday 3 November Yasser Arafat 's was transferred to the intensive care unit . Since then there have been conflicting reports about whether or not Yasser Arafat 's has died . Funeral plans were under discussion and Palestinian factions met on Tuesday to discuss arrangements . Egypt might host funeral services . France reached an agreement with Israel , which wants burial in the Gaza Strip for Yasser Arafat 's to be buried at Yasser Arafat 's headquarters in Ramallah . Israel , which wants burial in the Gaza Strip refused to allow Yasser Arafat 's to be buried in Jerusalem .

summary: Expecting an official announcement of Yasser Arafat 's death on Wednesday , November 10 , Palestinians made plans and preparations for Yasser Arafat 's funeral . A Muslim cleric flew to Paris to be with Yasser Arafat 's . Yasser Arafat 's died at 3:30 a.m. , November 11 . Yasser Arafat 's body would be flown to Cairo for a memorial service there scheduled for Friday . After a memorial service there scheduled for Friday , His body would be flown to Ramallah for burial at Yasser Arafat 's headquarters there . Israel sealed off the West Bank and Gaza Strip for security . The Palestinian Authority declared a 40 - day mourning period . The Palestinian Minister of State said His body would be brought to Cairo where world leaders could pay world leaders respects and then to West Bank for his funeral . The hospital where Yasser Arafat 's had lain in a coma confirmed that Yasser Arafat 's died on November 11 at 3:30 am but gave no details . Palestinian authorities declared a 40 - day mourning period and ordered businesses to close for three days . Hours after died Israel sealed off the West Bank and Gaza Strip . Israel tightened security at Jewish settlements before his funeral . Only Palestinians with permits were allowed to attend his funeral . On 10 November , speculation continued on whether Yasser Arafat 's was alive . Palestinians announced that upon died His body would be flown to Egypt for a funeral service , then to Ramallah , for burial at his headquarters there . In the afternoon , space for the grave was being cleared . Yasser Arafat 's died at 0230 GMT on November 11 . Yasser Arafat 's reportedly had suffered liver and kidney failure . The Palestinians announced a 40 - day mourning period , with government offices closed for 7 days and businesses closed for 3 days . Israel sealed the West Bank and Gaza Strip . Yasser Arafat 's lay in a coma at The hospital where Arafat had lain in a coma for a week and died at 0230 GMT on Thursday 10 November . No cause of death was given . The Palestinian Authority declared a 40 - day mourning period with private businesses closed for three days , public institutions for seven . His body was to be flown to Cairo for a funeral Friday to be attended by Arab and international leaders . Then His body was to be flown to Ramallah for burial in the presidential compound . Israel sealed off the West Bank and Gaza Strip and tightened security & quot;to allow a dignified funeral ceremony.&quot ;

summary: National League Nationals were named before National League Nationals have approval to play in Washington and a new owner . Major League baseball remains the owner of the Montreal Expos . National League Nationals will play at RFK stadium for National League Nationals first three seasons . Settlement of a financing plan for a new ballpark led to the approval of the move of the Montreal Expos to Washington . National League Nationals will debut in an exhibition game against the New York Mets in Florida . The first regular season home game will be on April 14 . Baltimore Orioles owner Peter Angelos opposed bringing baseball to Washington . Major League Baseball owners conditionally approved the move of The Expos to DC to Washington in 2005 . No owner was in place . Mayor Anthony Williams pledged that Washington would build a new ballpark . its first three seasons National League Nationals would play at RFK stadium . City Council chairman Linda Cropp insisted half the construction cost be paid for privately but a compromise was reached . The Cleveland - based Gates Group offered $ 100 million in return for parking revenues . Baltimore Orioles owner Peter Angelos claimed a monopoly on regional baseball broadcasting . Public resentment grew concerning the high stadium cost . After 33 years of no baseball , in late December 2004 , all parties agreed to move National League Nationals to Washington After many snags , Mayor Anthony Williams reached a compromise approved by both Major League baseball and the city council . National League Nationals will play in RFK stadium until a city - financed , $ 500 - million stadium is completed for the 2008 season . National League Nationals sold 20,000 season tickets . National League Nationals will play the first game in Washington on April 3 and the first regular season game there on April 14 . President Bush will attend . Baltimore Orioles owner Peter Angelos continues to threaten litigation . Major league baseball owners approved move on 3 December if Washington could provide funding for a new ballpark by 31 December . An agreement was reached on 22 December for a 400 - million - dollar stadium . National League Nationals would play in RFK stadium until a new ballpark could be built . National League Nationals won National League Nationals first exhibition game in Florida on 22 March , defeating the New York Mets 5 - 3 , and were scheduled to make National League Nationals DC debut in an exhibition game against the New York Mets at RFK stadium on 3 April .

summary: The Washington Nationals expect 45,000 for The Washington Nationals home opener with President Bush throwing the first ceremonial pitch . More than 22,000 season tickets have been sold . Manager Frank Robinson saw The Washington Nationals win their home opener tied for first place . The Washington Nationals expects a pre - tax profit of $ 20M. Eight groups interested in ownership could bid up to $ 400M. Republicans oppose allowing a group that includes billionaire liberal George Soros to become owners of The Washington Nationals . The Washington Nationals games have limited TV exposure due to legal battles resulting , in part , from the Orioles opposition to the move of the Expos to Washington . their home opener was sold out . Fans were excited to have baseball in Washington again . For subsequent games , although The Washington Nationals were in first place and playing well , The Washington Nationals played to two - thirds capacity , with little season - ticket base . Bidders for ownership include billionaire liberal George Soros , Colin Powell , and other political figures . The Washington Nationals have one of the lowest player payrolls in baseball . RFK Stadium is old and must be shared with soccer team DC United . The pitchers mound is lowered for soccer games and built up again but gives pitchers problems . Legal problems between Comcast and Peter Angelos limit The Washington Nationals TV exposure . The Washington Nationals enjoyed a very successful beginning to the baseball season . By June , The Washington Nationals was on pace to earn a $ 22 million profit . The residents were excited , merchandise sales were in the top five , The Washington Nationals outdrew the Orioles , and attendance was the ninth highest . Manager Frank Robinson and Manager Frank Robinson no - name players led the National League on June 26 , despite the low payroll and nonexistent farm system . Significant issues , however , remain ; The Washington Nationals has still not been sold , games are not on local cable , and sharing RFK Stadium with a major league soccer team creates problems . As of 13 April , The Washington Nationals were tied for first in The Washington Nationals division . The Washington Nationals won their home opener 5 - 3 over Arizona before a sold - out stadium and by 11 June had won 10 of 11 games . More than 22,000 season tickets have been sold and The Washington Nationals may make a pre - tax profit of $ 20 million in The Washington Nationals first season . Attendance has been strong . Legal problems have limited The Washington Nationals television exposure . Some Washingtonians have protested that money should be spent on new schools , not a stadium .

summary: Sandra Day O'Connor announced that Sandra Day O'Connor was retiring from the Supreme Court effective upon confirmation of Sandra Day O'Connor successor . Minutes after announced political leaders and lobby groups prepared for the ensuing battle . Liberals did not want an & quot;extremist&quot ; and Republicans wanted a judge who would apply rather than interpret the Constitution . President Bush 's choice of a judge was important because of key cases in abortion , assisted suicide and gay rights . One of the difficulties in nominating a judge is that a judge do not always vote the way one would assume , given a judge political affiliation or ideology . Sandra Day O'Connor is retiring . Sandra Day O'Connor gave no reason but a the Supreme Court spokesman indicated Sandra Day O'Connor need to spend more time with Sandra Day O'Connor husband who has Alzheimer 's . O'Connor , the first woman to serve on the Supreme Court was considered a conservative when seated but became more moderate over the years . President Reagan appointed Sandra Day O'Connor in 1981 . President Bush 's now has President Bush 's first opportunity to nominate someone to the Supreme Court and promises to do so in a timely manner . Liberals warned against picking an & quot;extremist&quot ; while Republicans argued for a strict conservative . Sandra O'Connor , 75 , appointed to the Supreme Court by President Reagan in 1981 and first woman on the Supreme Court , announced Sandra Day O'Connor retirement , effective on confirmation of her successor . Sandra Day O'Connor will spend time with her husband who has Alzheimer 's . President Bush 's promised to be deliberate , thorough , and timely in choosing a successor ; to have no litmus test on abortion or gay marriage ; and to pick a strict constitutionist who will not legislate from the bench . This first vacancy in 11 years gives President Bush 's the chance to shape the Supreme Court ideological balance . O'Connor was a frequent swing vote . President Bush 's chastised critics of Alberto Gonzales as a candidate . July 1 , 2005 Sandra Day O'Connor retiring , effective with the confirmation of her successor . One of only two female justices , Sandra Day O'Connor gave no reason . Sandra Day O'Connor is 75 , has served 24 years , and her husband who has Alzheimer 's has Alzheimer 's . President Bush 's began a & quot;deliberate and thorough&quot ; hunt for a replacement . Liberals warned President Bush 's to avoid an extremist , while conservatives urged President Bush 's to pick a strict constructionist . Four male federal judges and the Attorney General were mentioned . Abortion is a key question . Many discussed past appointments where a justice surprised President Bush 's by making a shift - to the right or left .

summary: After learning President Bush planned to nominate Judge John G. Roberts for a seat on the Supreme Court Abortions Rights Groups directed Abortions Rights Groups members to call Abortions Rights Groups senators to express opposition . Conservative activist groups voiced strong support for Judge John G. Roberts . There were early hints that Judge John G. Roberts would likely be confirmed . For one , President Bush had passed over candidates who would have made conservative groups happier . President Bush urged the divided US Senate to confirm Judge John G. Roberts by early October . Republican reaction to Judge John G. Roberts was overwhelmingly supportive , but Democrats reacted more cautiously and with reservations , admitting that Judge John G. Roberts had suitable legal credentials . President Bush nominated Judge John G. Roberts to the Supreme Court to replace O'Connor . In doing so President Bush resisted pressure to name a woman or Hispanic . O'Connor was a crucial swing vote on the Supreme Court . Liberals fear and conservatives hope that confirmed will move the Supreme Court decidedly to the right O'Connor said of Judge John G. Roberts : & quot;He 's good in every way , except Judge John G. Roberts 's not a woman&quot ; . Pro - choice activists indicated opposition to Judge John G. Roberts . President Bush nominated Judge John G. Roberts to replace O'Connor . Liberals and abortion rights supporters immediately mobilized Liberals and abortion rights supporters opposition . Conservatives began Conservatives campaign to support Judge John G. Roberts before Judge John G. Roberts was announced . Both sides have spent years preparing for this , poring over records of potential nominees and amassing war chests . Judge John G. Roberts has been a judge for only two years but was considered fair . Judge John G. Roberts has argued that Roe v. Wade was wrongly decided and ruled that special military tribunals at Guantanamo Bay could proceed . Judge John G. Roberts was expected to be confirmed . President Bush passed over even more conservative candidates . On July 19 , President Bush named Judge John G. Roberts to replace O'Connor . Judge John G. Roberts graduated from Harvard Law School , clerked for Chief Justice Rehnquist , and worked in two Republican administrations . Judge John G. Roberts has been a judge on federal appeals court for one year , creating no record on controversial subjects such as abortion and federalism . The release of some documents from Judge John G. Roberts White House service is expected . Many regret that Judge John G. Roberts is a white male , as were all but four of past nominees . Although liberals and conservatives are ready for a fight in the divided US Senate , intense acrimony is not expected .

summary: Vice President Dick Cheney did not have a valid hunting license when Vice President Dick Cheney shot Harry Whittington in February 2006 . have added to the uproar caused by shot and by Vice President Dick Cheney staff delaying a report of shot for 20 hours . Vice President Dick Cheney accidentally sprayed Harry Whittington with bird shot in the face , neck and chest while they hunted on a ranch in south Texas . Harry Whittington was treated on the scene by Vice President Dick Cheney medical detail before being taken by helicopter to a Corpus Christi hospital . Harry Whittington was in stable condition the next day . Vice President Dick Cheney was apologetic . On February 2006 Vice President Dick Cheney shot a hunting companion in Texas . Vice President Dick Cheney turned and fired at a covey of birds , not realizing that Harry Whittington , was in the line of fire . Harry Whittington was immediately treated and hospitalized . shot was reported by a local newspaper the following day and only then did Vice President Dick Cheney office confirm shot , 20 hours after shot happened . Controversy surrounds shot . Who was at fault ? Why did n't the White House announce shot sooner ? Vice President Dick Cheney handled the matter of an illegal hunting license by mailing a $ 7 check to Texas . Vice President Dick Cheney accidentally shot a hunting companion on February 2006 during a weekend quail hunting trip in Texas . Vice President Dick Cheney friend , attorney Harry Whittington from Austin , was sprayed in the face , neck , and chest with birdshot . Harry Whittington was reported to be in stable condition in a Corpus Christi hospital . shot was first reported by the Corpus Christi Caller - Times . Cheney 's office disclosed shot 20 hours after shot occurred . the White House staff was criticized for delaying . shot provided a wealth of material for Democrats , gun control activists and late night comedians . On a ranch in south Texas on February 2006 , Vice President Dick Cheney accidentally shot a hunting companion . Whittington , peppered on the right side , received emergency care and then was flown to a Corpus Christi hospital . Harry Whittington was moved from the intensive care unit on February 13 . Eyewitnesses said shot was Harry Whittington fault . Although the White House was notified within hours , the news was not made public until nearly 20 hours , when , with Vice President Dick Cheney permission , the ranch hostess alerted the local press . The timing and manner of notification drew sharp criticism from observers and the White House .

One of the 100 shotgun pellets that wounded Harry Whittington , the Texas lawyer shot by Vice President Cheney moved into his heart and caused a heart attack . Doctors decided not to remove One of the 100 shotgun pellets that wounded him , saying Doctors would treat Harry Whittington , the Texas lawyer shot by Vice President Cheney condition medically . The White House Press Secretary learned about a heart attack just before a press conference , but The White House Press Secretary did not mention a heart attack . The accident and heart attach caused a media frenzy . Some Vice President Cheney friends blamed Harry Whittington , the Texas lawyer shot by Vice President Cheney , but five days later , Vice President Cheney spoke to the media , accepting full responsibility . On Feb. 14 Harry Whittington , the Texas lawyer shot by Vice President Cheney suffered a setback when One of the 100 shotgun pellets that wounded him penetrated his heart . his condition focused attention on the unanswered questions : Whose fault and why the delay in reporting ? In Texas a sheriff 's office cleared Vice President Cheney of any wrongdoing . On the question of delay , Bush 's staff deferred to Vice President Cheney and Vice President Cheney to Bush 's staff Texas hosts . On Feb. 15 Vice President Cheney broke Vice President Cheney silence in a Fox News interview , accepting full - blame for shot , but defending Vice President Cheney decision to leave the reporting of shot to the owner of the ranch where shot occurred . Harry Whittington , the Texas lawyer shot by Vice President Cheney suffered a heart attack as a result of birdshot in his heart . Harry Whittington , the Texas lawyer shot by Vice President Cheney is in stable condition and is still expected to fully recover . Doctors are optimistic One of the 100 shotgun pellets that wounded him wo n't cause future problems . Democrats accused Vice President Cheney of a pattern of secrecy for Vice President Cheney delay in reporting shot . Vice President Cheney spoke about shot in an interview on Feb. 15 , calling Feb. 14 one of the worst of Vice President Cheney life and accepting full blame for shot . A Texas sheriff 's office cleared Vice President Cheney of any wrongdoing in shot . One of the 100 shotgun pellets that wounded him caused Harry Whittington , the Texas lawyer shot by Vice President Cheney to suffer atrial fibrillation and a heart attack by the morning of Feb. 14 . Harry Whittington , the Texas lawyer shot by Vice President Cheney was returned to intensive care . Between 5 and 200 pellets are lodged in Harry Whittington , the Texas lawyer shot by Vice President Cheney body . Harry Whittington , the Texas lawyer shot by Vice President Cheney 's expected to remain hospitalized for a week . Vice President Cheney office released Cheney 's office first statement that afternoon , as conflicting stories began to surface . The handling of shot highlighted Cheney 's office penchant for secrecy and tensions between Bush 's and Vice President Cheney staffs . On the afternoon of Feb. 15 during a Fox News interview , Vice President Cheney accepted blame for shot , but defended the information handling .

summary: Four US ex - presidents , a Hollywood legend , a retired fireman and a star TV journalist were among the 31 appointed in December 2004 to lead the project for a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center . Four US ex - presidents , a Hollywood legend , a retired fireman and a star TV journalist were to be directors of a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center . Architect Michael Arad 's design was chosen from 5,201 entries in an international competition . Architect Michael Arad 's design featured two reflecting pools surrounded by gardens . Part of the $ 500 million in financing will come from New York 's $ 816 million in federal grants . a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center held a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center first meeting on January 6 . a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center priority is raising $ 500 million to build a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center and two cultural buildings . Four US ex - presidents are honorary directors . Prominent a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center members include Robert De Niro , Barbara Walters , David Rockefeller , and former Canadian prime minister Brian Mulroney . Architect Michael Arad 's design , Reflecting Absence , was chosen for a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center . a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center is planned to include a forest of oak trees and a Memorial Hall . An underground interpretive center will house artifacts from the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center . a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center is scheduled to open in 2009 . The task of raising $ 500 M for a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center will fall to a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center . Four US ex - presidents have agreed to become honorary directors of the project for a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center . a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center is accepting all levels of gifts . Governor Pataki said financing of a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center should be the top priority for allocating money from the Lower Manhattan Development Corporation 's $ 816 M grant . a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center features two reflecting pools surrounded by gardens . Architect Michael Arad 's design was chosen from 5201 entries . In December 2004 , 31 people were named to the board of directors of a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center . a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center is a non - profit corporation to oversee fundraising and construction , then own and operate a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center . a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center will have a plaza , fountains , ramps , building and human remains , names of victims , and fragments of the 1993 memorial . There also will be an interpretation center , museum and arts center . a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center completion is scheduled for 2009 . a memorial to the victims of the September 11 , 2001 , attack on New York 's World Trade Center is faced with raising almost 1/2 billion dollars and overseeing the reconciliation of the architectural vision with the physical realities .

summary: In May , 2005 , Governor Pataki announced Governor Pataki would earmark $ 300 million to jumpstart fund - raising for the September 11 memorial . Governor Pataki also planned to push ahead the timetable for redesign of the Freedom Tower office building . By doing so Governor Pataki admitted the effort to build the September 11 memorial had suffered serious setbacks . Families of the victims criticized the design , including the cultural building : Too large ; the streetwalls ; too high . Families of the victims objected to changes : Two pedestrian ramps instead of four . The original design was being whittled away . Goldman Sachs suspended plans to build a $ 2 billion 40 - story headquarters at the site . The the September 11 memorial project has bogged down while negotiations over issues of condemnation and imminent domain are hashed out . Design revisions have further complicated The World Trade Center memorial project . Family members of 9/11 victims expressed displeasure with many of the proposed amendments to Arad 's design . Family members of 9/11 victims believe the September 11 memorial has taken a backseat to commercial interests and have called for a fundraising boycott . Governor Pataki announced Governor Pataki will appoint Governor Pataki chief of staff to take control of the rebuilding effort . Governor Pataki will also use public funds to jumpstart the rebuilding effort . A temporary memorial will open on July 11 . Elements of The original design have been whittled away by logistical realities , client demands and concerns expressed by Family members of 9/11 victims . the Freedom Tower office building will be redesigned because of security concerns . The proposed reduction of four pedestrian ramps to two raised safety concerns . the September 11 memorial is expected to cost $ 350 M including the Memorial Center - a separate design . Governor Pataki assigned his chief of staff to coordinate the work of each agency and institution involved in the redevelopment of and around the September 11 memorial . Spring and early summer brought more controversies to the September 11 memorial . A new Foundation CEO was named . One last parcel of land still was needed . Various interest groups were battling over aspects of the ground zero area including the International Freedom Center , the Drawing Center , the Performing arts center , and the Freedom Tower office building . The families of victims were fighting commercial interests . The Foundation 's money drive is falling short , but Governor Pataki has promised some public funds . Elements of The original design are continually being altered . Two spot - gap memorial projects were begun in June and July .

summary: Juan Alvarez left Juan Alvarez car on a railroad track in Glendale CA . his car set off a collision that derailed two trains , killed at least 10 people and injured nearly 200 . Witnesses identified Juan Alvarez and Juan Alvarez was detained . Juan Alvarez was distraught and put on suicide watch . Glendale police believed Juan Alvarez intended to commit suicide but changed Juan Alvarez mind . Juan Alvarez was taken into custody and charged with at least 10 counts of homicide . Investigators felt Juan Alvarez wanted to kill Juan Alvarez because Juan Alvarez estranged wife denied Juan Alvarez visits with Juan Alvarez children . Juan Alvarez was held on suspicion of murder in Los Angeles without bail . Juan Alvarez left his car on a railroad track in Glendale , where his car set off a collision that derailed two trains and killed ten people ( later raised to eleven ) and injured nearly 200 . Police held Juan Alvarez on ten counts of murder and indicated that Juan Alvarez had intended suicide but changed his mind and fled his car before the train struck . Juan Alvarez , remained at the scene and was cooperating with police . Juan Alvarez has a criminal record involving drugs and his estranged wife obtained a restraining order against Juan Alvarez . Juan Alvarez drove his car onto Glendale train tracks in a suicide attempt . When his car got stuck between Glendale train tracks Juan Alvarez got out and left . A southbound Metrolink commuter train crashed into his car and climbed over his car . The front cab car rammed into an adjacent stationary Union Pacific work train and toppled an adjacent stationary Union Pacific work train . The remaining cars jackknifed and derailed a northbound Metrolink commuter train . The accident and subsequent fire killed 11 and injured nearly 200 . Juan Alvarez watched The accident and subsequent fire then attempted suicide again by slashing Juan Alvarez wrists and stabbing Juan Alvarez . Juan Alvarez was arrested and charged with homicide . A train crash in Glendale , on 26 January killed 11 people and injured close to 200 , many critically . A southbound commuter train , pushed from behind by a locomotive , hit his car , then hit a freight train and a northbound commuter train . Police arrested Juan Alvarez . At first , self - inflicted superficial wounds led investigators to think that it was an attempted suicide . It was determined later that Juan Alvarez got self - inflicted superficial wounds after Juan Alvarez fled the scene .

summary: The crash renewed concerns of engineers and safety experts that it is unsafe for locomotives to push rather than pull cars . The LA County DA expressed serious doubts about law enforcers ' comments that Alvarez was deranged or insane and suggested Alvarez may have been trying to send a message to Alvarez estranged wife when Alvarez left Alvarez SUV on the tracks . Alvarez remained heavily sedated and under suicide watch . Prosecutors said Alvarez caused The crash to get his estranged wife attention and sympathy . Alvarez pled not guilty to murder and arson charges and prosecutors sought the death penalty against Alvarez . Prosecutors added arson to murder and arson charges after it was determined that Alvarez had poured gasoline on his SUV . The district attorney has contradicted the police and has suggested that Alvarez act was calculated and not a suicidal or insane act . A Glendale policeman said that Alvarez planned to create a & quot;spectacular&quot ; scene to gain his estranged wife sympathy . Alvarez has pleaded not guilty to all counts and is being held without bail . Alvarez lawyer maintains Alvarez was despondent over Alvarez marriage break - up and planned to kill Alvarez but not others . Witnesses saw Alvarez douse his SUV with gasoline , position his SUV across the tracks and walk away . Train 100 's lead car pushed his SUV down the tracks , derailed , turned on Train 100 's lead car side and slid into a freight car , toppling a freight car . As Train 901 passed , the jackknifed Train 100 's cars derailed Train 901 rear two cars . Alvarez was trying to create a spectacle to win back his estranged wife , not commit suicide . Alvarez slashed Alvarez arms and chest superficially with scissors . Alvarez pleaded not guilty to murder and arson charges . Prosecutors are seeking the death penalty . It appeared that Alvarez had not slashed Alvarez wrists and that Alvarez other wounds were not life - threatening . Alvarez was charged with murder . Arson was added to murder and arson charges because forensic tests had revealed the presence of gasoline in and on his SUV and witnesses said that witnesses had seen Alvarez douse his SUV before abandoning his SUV . Alvarez might have intended to create a spectacular scene to get his estranged wife sympathy . In May Alvarez pleaded not guilty to murder and arson charges . Prosecutors will seek the death penalty .

summary: Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) was scheduled to open in three phases in the summer of 2005 . Early to mid - August transportation would be available to some areas of Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) . August - Sept 11 all public services would become available . Sept 12 the grand opening of the park and hotels would take place . On Aug 16 HKD will begin HKD rehearsals to which special guests will be invited . In September , HKD announced HKD would not cut HKD daily capacity of 30,000 visitors . On Sept 9 it was revealed that all tickets for the grand opening of the park and hotels had been sold . Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) was built by Walt Disney Company and the HKSA government in 2005 in three phases to ensure a smooth start . Walt Disney Company consulted Chinese feng shui before building Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) and Chinese feng shui influences were incorporated into Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) physical orientation , opening date , and local cultural considerations . Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) staged Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) rehearsal period for four weeks before opening for employee performance practice . While ticket sales were initially good , ticket sales were disappointing . the HKSA government funded the bulk of Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) and was positive about Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) initially . After a while the HKSA government questioned whether Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) was a reasonable deal for the HKSA government . Walt Disney Company consulted Chinese feng shui experts before building Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) . Changes included tilting the site , orienting the site to face water with mountains behind , and creating water fountains and ' no fire zones ' in kitchens . Walt Disney Company directed a massive marketing campaign at mainland China . A three - phased opening rehearsal would begin in early August and last about a month , to allow for familiarization and adjustment . Walt Disney Company declined to cut maximum capacity of 30,000 despite complaints of crowds and long lines but removed shark fin soup from Walt Disney Company menu after environmentalist complaints . Expensive hotel rates dampened mainland ticket sales . More hotel rooms were planned . Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) was scheduled to open on 12 September . Rehearsal days were staged for a month before opening , giving & quot;cast members&quot ; a chance to practice & quot;cast members&quot ; performances . Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) refused to reduce HKD daily maximum capacity of 30,000 despite complaints from early visitors about large crowds and long lines . All 16,000 opening day tickets were sold out . Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) is vintage Disney , with aspects of local culture including feng shui , Asian foods , and signs in Chinese . Protests forced Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) to remove shark fin soup from Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) menus .

summary: Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) officially opened as planned on Sept. 12 with about 16,000 people attending including the Chinese vice president . Workers at Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) soon complained of long hours without break and quick turnarounds , raising the issue of unionization . Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) repeatedly refused a release of attendance figures . By November Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) offered discount tickets to residents of Hong Kong and on Nov. 21 a press report said attendance was falling below earlier government projections . On Nov. 22 Disney replied that & quot;well over&quot ; 1 million people had visited Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) and that & quot;attendance is ramping up well.&quot ; about 16,000 people attended the Disney opening . Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) employed 5000 people and was predicted to draw 5.6 million people the first year . Two weeks after opening Disney activists were concerned about the harsh working conditions . Disney officials discouraged unionizing . The HKSAR government defended Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) against the harsh working conditions , saying Disney needed time to learn the local culture . Two months after Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) opened , Disney lowered the ticket price , denying the ticket price was related to low attendance , and refused to discuss attendance . The HKSAR government argued Disney should reveal attendance numbers to Disney because The HKSAR government were the largest Disney investor . Hong Kong and Disney agreed to build Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) in 1999 , with Hong Kong majority owner . Construction began in 2003 . On opening day , Sept. 12 , 2005 , about 16,000 people attended and demonstrators protested labor abuses at Chinese factories making Disney products . Park workers describe long hours , long travel times , harsh turnarounds and lack of breaks . Activists want Hong Kong Disney workers to unionize but Disney resists , despite unions at US and French Disneylands . Disney denies low attendance and is criticized for lack of transparency . Disney offered local residents discounted tickets . Mainland China , expected to be the major source of visitors , provided only 25 percent . Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) opened as scheduled on 12 September . Over 80 % of the visitors in the first month rated Over 80 % of the visitors in the first month experience as very good or excellent . Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) drew fewer visitors than expected in Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) first two months , despite offering a discount for Hong Kong residents . Disney steadfastly refused to disclose attendance figures - a move that angered lawmakers since The HKSAR government owns a 57 % stake Hong Kong Disneyland ( HKD ) . In late November Disney said that there had been & quot;well over&quot ; one million guests . Workers complained about long hours , short turnarounds , and lack of breaks .

summary: At 10:24 p.m. EST on December 24,2004 , NASA 's Deep Space tracking stations received a signal that the space probe , Huygens , had separated from the space probe , Huygens , mothership to begin a descent to Saturn 's largest moon , Titan . the space probe , Huygens , would spend three weeks descending toward Saturn 's largest moon , Titan , shooting pictures for 2 - 1/2 hours before hitting the surface . Saturn 's largest moon , Titan is the only moon in the Solar System that has an atmosphere . During the seven years its mothership took to reach Saturn 's , the space probe , Huygens , was powered through an umbilical cable and awakened from sleep mode every six months for tests . After a seven - year journey , the space probe , Huygens , successfully separated from its mothership at about 10:24 p.m. EST December 24,2004 , beginning the space probe , Huygens , three - week , 2 million - mile free fall toward Saturn 's moon Titan . the space probe , Huygens , will remain dormant until January 14 , when the space probe , Huygens , will float to the surface on parachutes , shooting pictures and sending back data for about 2.5 hours before hitting the surface . Scientists hope the space probe , Huygens , will confirm the assumption that Saturn 's largest moon , Titan atmosphere is similar to that of early Earth . The mission is a joint project of NASA 's , the European Space Agency and the Italian Space Agency . the space probe , Huygens , is a 9 - foot landing probe , built by the European Space Agency . the space probe , Huygens , is riding on its mothership . its mothership flew twice past Venus , once past early Earth , and once past Jupiter - 2.2 billion miles - before its mothership first orbit around Saturn 's began on July 1 , 2004 . its mothership continued these orbits until December 24,2004 . On December 24,2004 , the space probe , Huygens , separated from its mothership and began a forecasted 20 - day , 2.5 million mile ballistic path to Saturn 's largest moon , Titan . the space probe , Huygens , is designed to study Saturn 's largest moon , Titan atmosphere and take photographs . the space probe , Huygens , was carried by NASA 's Cassini spacecraft on a seven - year journey . the space probe , Huygens , separated successfully from its mothership on Christmas Eve and began a 2.5 - million - mile 20 - day descent to Saturn 's largest moon Titan , the only moon in the Solar System that has atmosphere . During a 2.5 - million - mile 20 - day descent to Saturn 's largest moon Titan , the only moon in the solar system that has atmosphere the space probe , Huygens , will sample Titan 's atmosphere . Everything must work perfectly because there is no way to adjust the space probe , Huygens , course . Progress was being carefully followed by NASA 's and the 16 European nations involved in The mission .

summary: Descending through poisonous haze , the Huygens space probe landed on Titan January 14 , 2005 . Photographs the Huygens space probe took near the surface revealed a frigid realm of apparent rivers , lakes and icy boulders . Scientists were ecstatic at having achieved the first spacecraft landing on the moon of another planet . the first spacecraft landing on the moon of another planet , represented the farthest from Earth that a spacecraft had ever landed , about 890 million miles away . Titan dense hydrocarbon smog suggests complex chemical processes like those that led to life on Earth . European scientists built the Huygens space probe to learn more by probing the surface . the Huygens space probe landed safely on the surface as scheduled on January 14 , 2005 . Mission controllers were confident the Huygens space probe landed on a solid , soft surface . the Huygens space probe continued to send back pictures and data after landed , and would continue to do so until the Huygens space probe batteries ran out . The initial black and white images of the surface sent by the Huygens space probe before noon EST astonished scientists . the first spacecraft landing on the moon of another planet , represents the farthest from Earth that a spacecraft has landed . the first spacecraft landing on the moon of another planet also is the first landing of a spacecraft on the moon of another planet . the Huygens space probe landed safely on the surface on January 14 , 2005 . The initial black and white images of Titan 's surface sent by Huygens before noon EST brought gasps and cheers from the scientists . The initial black and white images of Titan 's surface sent by Huygens before noon EST appeared to reveal drainage channels , flooded plains , shore lines , and a surface strewn with frozen blocks . the Huygens space probe had gathered environment data and photographs for 3 hours during the Huygens space probe descent and for 10 minutes on the surface before the batteries died . The mission was declared a fantastic success and The mission output will be studied for years . the Huygens space probe is & quot;a fantastic success for Europe.&quot ; During the 2 - 1/2 - hour descent through Titan atmosphere , the Huygens space probe filmed the surface , measured wind speed and pressure , and analyzed the atmosphere . The first pictures , taken from a height of about 10 miles as the Huygens space probe descended , showed a strange , rugged terrain with drainage channels for liquids . the Huygens space probe landed safely on the surface at about 1234 GMT on January 14 , 2005 and the sensors , which were expected to work for only three minutes after landed , continued to function for at least 30 minutes .

summary: In early 2005 , a Taiwanese official said Beijing 's plan to pass an anti - secession law was aimed at legalizing a mainland invasion of a Taiwanese official country . Beijing 's plan to pass an anti - secession law would undermine stabililty across the Taiwan Strait , according to his country President Chen . his country sent six delegations to the U.S. , Japan and EU countries the year before to brief officials on the adverse impact on cross - strait relations an anti - secession law would have . Beijing 's said in March , that & quot;one country , two systems&quot ; was Beijing 's basic approach to his country , outlining , for the first time , Beijing 's anti - secession law that was being considered by the National People 's Congress . Planned consideration of an anti - secession law by the National People 's Congress stirred strong reactions in his country . Taiwanese see an anti - secession law as establishing a legal justification for a military invasion of his country . Furthermore , an anti - secession law would diminish cross - the Taiwan Strait travel and restrict free expression of ideas , hindering cross - strait rapprochement . his country claimed the support of U.S. and European Union in opposing an anti - secession law . On March 8 , 2005 as the National People 's Congress began deliberations on an anti - secession law , spokesmen defended an anti - secession law as a means of promoting China 's peaceful reunification on the basis of & quot;one country , two systems.&quot ; Beijing 's claims its anti - secession law that was being considered by the National People 's Congress is aimed at promoting a peaceful reunification with his country . Beijing 's denies that its anti - secession law that was being considered by the National People 's Congress would be used to justify military action . Beijing 's maintains that the one country , two systems approach is best for his country . his country fears its anti - secession law that was being considered by the National People 's Congress is designed to legalize a Beijing 's military invasion . his country says its anti - secession law that was being considered by the National People 's Congress is a provocation that would undermine stability across the Taiwan Strait . his country ruling and opposition parties agreed to adopt a resolution against its anti - secession law that was being considered by the National People 's Congress . U.S. and EU support his country position . his country considers Beijing 's plan to enact an anti - secession law a provocative move to change the status quo in the Taiwan Strait . Emphasizing that his country is not a part of Beijing 's as Beijing 's claims , his country believes its anti - secession law that was being considered by the National People 's Congress is aimed at establishing a legal justification for Beijing 's invasion of his country . The US and EU counterproductive to peace . Beijing 's claims that its anti - secession law that was being considered by the National People 's Congress is designed to check the secessionist activities of & quot;Taiwan independence&quot ; forces and promote China 's reunification . The Beijing 's legislature is scheduled to take up its anti - secession law that was being considered by the National People 's Congress in March .

summary: The legislative caucus of the ruling Democratic Progressive Party of Taiwan condemned Beijing for passing the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan on March 14 . The legislative caucus of the ruling Democratic Progressive Party of Taiwan statement said passing severely infringes upon the freedom , dignity and security of the Taiwan people . Taiwan and the People 's Republic of China are two separate political entities , The legislative caucus of the ruling Democratic Progressive Party of Taiwan said , and Taiwan sovereignty should be respected by the People 's Republic of China . The White House branded & quot;unfortunate&quot ; the People 's Republic of China adoption of the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan . US lawmakers expressed & quot;grave concern.&quot ; Many nations expressed approval , including France , Cuba , Kenya , Kuwait , Cambodia , Zambia , Cameroon and other African countries . On March 14 the NPC adopted the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan 2896 - 0 , with Premier Wen Jiabao declaring the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan would strengthen ties across the Taiwan Straits . On Taiwan the president condemned adopted saying the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan damages the development of cross - strait relations . Taiwan share prices fell 1.5 percent . In Washington The White House declared the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan & quot;unfortunate&quot ; and the House of Representatives expressed & quot;grave concern&quot ; by a vote of 424 - 4 . Most world comment , however , was positive with statements of support from France , Cuba , Kenya , Kuwait , Bosnia - Herzegovina , United Arab Emirates , Nigeria , Rwanda , Croatia and others . On March 13 , the People 's Republic of China announced the People 's Republic of China adoption of the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan . Taiwan condemned Beijing for passing the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan , saying the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan caused irreparable damage to cross - strait relations . Taiwan officials said that Taiwan is an independent sovereign state belonging to the Taiwan people . Any move to change the status quo without the Taiwan people approval is unacceptable . Taiwan share prices dropped sharply . The US expressed concern and called the People 's Republic of China adoption of the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan unfortunate . the People 's Republic of China announced that more countries supported the People 's Republic of China adoption of the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan than not and listed numerous tiny countries , mostly in Africa and Asia , and France . the People 's Republic of China legislature adopted the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan 2,896 to zero on 14 March . The Chinese Premier declared that the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan was designed to strengthen ties across the Taiwan Straits , that the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan was aimed not at mobilizing for war but at maintaining peace , and that the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan would encourage cooperation . In reply , Taiwan ruling party condemned the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan , claiming that the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan severely infringed on the freedom , dignity , and security of Taiwan , and asked the international community to denounce the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan . The U.S. expressed grave concern over the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan , but a majority of countries supported the Anti - Secession law targeting Taiwan .

summary: Two men accused of bombing an Air India jet , killing 329 people in 1985 , were tried in Vancouver nearly 20 years later . Prosecutors charged that Two men accused of bombing an Air India jet , killing 329 people in 1985 were Sikhs taking revenge against the Indian government , which owned Air India planes , for attacking a Sikh temple in 1984 . Prosecutors case rested upon Prosecutors providing financial assistance to a man convicted in the case , attempting to interfere with investigations , and admissions to people Prosecutors trusted . Defense lawyers attacked the credibility of witnesses . There were years of bungled police work and unexplained killings of witnesses . Two men accused of bombing an Air India jet , killing 329 people in 1985 , were charged with the 1985 bombing of an Air India jet that killed 329 people and with killing two baggage handlers at Narita Airport . Final arguments in Two men accused of bombing an Air India jet , killing 329 people in 1985 murder trial concluded in December 2004 . Prosecutors believe Two men accused of bombing an Air India jet , killing 329 people in 1985 motive was to avenge attacking . their murder trial was not settled due to years of bungled police work , unexpected killings of witnesses and a suspect , and vague and contradictory testimonies . Justice Ian Josephson , who heard the case without a jury , will deliver Justice Ian Josephson , who heard the case without a jury decision in March 2005 . a millionaire named Malik and a millworker named Bagri have been in custody over four years accused of bombing an Air India jet in June 1985 killing 329 people . Prosecutors believe Two men accused of bombing an Air India jet , killing 329 people in 1985 acted in revenge against the Indian government , which owned Air India planes , for attacking a Sikh temple in 1984 . their murder trial is being held in a bomb - proof court built especially for their murder trial . More than 100 witnesses have testified . Some key witnesses have offered vague and contradictory recollections . Two potential witnesses were assassinated and others received threats . Key evidence is circumstantial . Final arguments were presented in the British Columbian trial of two Indian Sikh immigrants accused of involvement in two bombings : an Air India jet ; and a bomb that killed two baggage handlers in Tokyo . Prosecutors held that Two men accused of bombing an Air India jet , killing 329 people in 1985 wanted revenge against the Indian government , which owned Air India planes , for attacking a Sikh temple in 1984 . Prosecutors argued against the credibility of three key witnesses . There is no physical evidence or first - hand testimony linking Two men accused of bombing an Air India jet , killing 329 people in 1985 to the bombings . The judge will deliver a decision on 16 March .
